intro: Mecodium minus, commonly known as the small mecodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stems, and it produces clusters of bright blue or purple flowers. Mecodium minus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
